description: Arzu Rana Deuba (born 26 January 1962) is a Nepali social worker, psychologist, and politician. She has served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs and is a member of the House of Representatives for the Nepali Congress party, of which she is a Central Committee member. She is married to former Prime Minister Sher Bahadur Deuba. Deuba has been a prominent advocate for women's rights, contributing to the Constitution of Nepal, and has founded several NGOs, including RUWDUC and Saathi.
short_description: Nepali social worker, psychologist and politician who served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs.
